t: The*pn Lord*s is my light and my salvation — whom*ln should I fear? The*ln Lord*s is the stronghold of my life — whom*ln should I dread?
When*ln evildoers came against me to devour my flesh, my*ln foes and my enemies stumbled and fell.
Though*ln an army deploys against me, my*ln heart will not be afraid; though*ln a war breaks out against me, I*ln will still be confident.

I*pn have asked one thing from the Lord;*s it*ln is what I desire: to*ln dwell in the house of the Lord*s all*ln the days of my life, gazing*ln on the beauty of the Lord*s and*ln seeking him in his temple.
For*ln he will conceal me in his shelter in*ln the day of adversity; he*ln will hide me under the cover of his tent; he*ln will set me high on a rock.
Then*ln my head will be high above*ln my enemies around me; I*ln will offer sacrifices in his tent with shouts of joy. I*ln will sing and make music to the Lord.*s
Lord,*spn hear my voice when I call; be*ln gracious to me and answer me.
My*ln heart says this about you: “Seek*ln his face.” Lord,*sln I will seek your face.
Do*ln not hide your face from me; do*ln not turn your servant away in anger. You*ln have been my helper; do*ln not leave me or abandon me, God*ln of my salvation.
Even*ln if my father and mother abandon me, the*ln Lord*s cares for me.
Because*pn of my adversaries, show*ln me your way, Lord,*s and*ln lead me on a level path.
Do*ln not give me over to the will of my foes, for*ln false witnesses rise up against me, breathing*ln violence.
I*pn am certain that I will see the Lord’s*s goodness in*ln the land of the living.
Wait*ln for the Lord;*s be*ln strong, and let your heart be courageous. Wait*ln for the Lord.*s
